alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 11:21AM CDT until May 05 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Okfuskee. In northeast Oklahoma, Okmulgee. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. Local media have reported water rescues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 AM CDT, emergency management reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Another area of thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall will move northeastward across Okfuskee and Okmulgee counties through 12:30 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Boley... Dewar... Schulter... Paden... Grayson... Bearden... Hoffman... Castle... Clearview... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Preston... Welty... Bald Hill... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
